name: Alexandra "Alex" Chen
backstory: Grew up in a hyper-competitive household where her parents demanded academic and professional excellence. Her older brother was a model student, leading to constant comparison; she felt pressured to outperform him at all costs. This environment fostered a need for control through perfectionism and criticality toward others (to maintain her own standards) while developing anxiety about any perceived failure.
goals: To learn to accept imperfection in both herself and others, reduce workaholism by setting boundaries, and build healthier relationships based on genuine connection rather than performance metrics.
needs: A need for structure and control in her life; a deep-seated need for validation through consistent achievement; a desire for emotional stability despite anxiety about failure.
emotions: A mix of stress from overwhelming work demands, guilt over being overly critical to colleagues, and a quiet fear that she'll never measure up to her own (or others') expectations.
